name: SUN 19th JAN 2014: Perform Your Songs - Performance Masterclass for Songwriters with Juliet Russell
description:
Performance Masterclass for Songwriters with Juliet Russell - Sunday Jan 19th 2014

£85/£72 (MASTERCLASS PARTICIPANT) or £25/£22 (MASTERCLASS AUDIENCE 
***(discounts are for PRS/MU/BASCA or Londonsongwriter Meetup members)

What makes a GREAT performance?
A masterclass day for all singer songwriters or performers run by Juliet Russell 
This seminar explores vocal technique, song interpretation & physical performance through analysis, discussion, professional guidance & practical, usable exercises.

Juliet is a professional singer and vocal coach on the BBC1 series The Voice UK and has coached grammy award winners, X factor finalists, signed artists and actors.  

Where: London - tbc
When: Sunday 19th January 11am to 6pm
Cost: There will be 8 "Masterclass Participants" paying £85 each, and a number of "Masterclass Audience" paying £25.  
Discounts (15%) for PRS/MU/BASCA and LondonSongwriterMeetup members
  
The 8 Participants will perform to the facilitators and to the audience and receive constructive feedback on their performances.   The whole group will take part in discussions, and there will be practical exercises for everyone to explore their vocal technique, song interpretation and physical performance.  
 
To Register - use the above payment dropdown boxes to make an online payment.

OR: Make an online Bank Transfer to: London Song Company Ltd: Natwest Bank 59088842 sort code 60 21 48 

OR: Post a cheque made payable to London Song Company Ltd - Katie Whitehouse, LSC, c/o 3 Glenarm Terrace, Totnes TQ9 5PY- and we will confirm your place on the Performance Masterclass by email.

name: Shaking The Songwriting Tree with Julian Marshall & India Bourne Sat 5/Sun 6 October 2013
description:
This two day course is designed for more experienced song-writers

The cost is £225 (see above) Please contact Julian@wigglylines.co.uk before booking on the course.

Do you ever feel constrained in your songwriting process? 

Do you ever feel held back in your expressive, musical language?  

Do you perhaps feel that there are externally imposed ideas about how a song should really go that you should stick to or just feel that you tend to return to the same writing methodologies and ideas over and over again? 

Do you long to 'take the lid off' your song writing and explore brand new expressive, creative territory?

If you feel any inkling of these things, then this course is for you! We will use this opportunity to explore the assumptions we make around song writing by examining various examples and ways that we and others may 'shake the tree' of expectations in a bid to find new, expressive musical language. We will listen to work (yours, mine, India's and others) discuss ideas of theory and practice and generally 'play in the songwriters sandpit' for two days.

I am delighted, on this occasion, to be co-leading this course with India Bourne who, as well as being a founder player with Ben Howard is very much an explorative songwriter in her own right...The specific purpose of this weekend is to create a forum of support for new, innovative, explorative work.  A place to ‘dare to try something new’
This course is an opportunity to share work (both complete and work in progress) and receive feedback in a ‘group master-class’ setting.  

The course leaders and participants will discuss your work in detail and suggest ideas and strategies for  further development. 

Please apply in writing to: Julian@wigglylines.co.uk  

The weekend will also include a pre-given task (given out early September) www.londonsongcompany.com 07832 200980

name: LSC Develop Your Songwriting London - 6 week evening course Oct/Nov 2013
description:
(Click on the drop down arrows above to see different payment options)

Facilitated by Julian Marshall and Jonathan Whiskerd, you will explore all elements of your songwriting (structure, lyrics, harmony, rhythm, pulse, hooks etc), and develop and refine your skills through writing a new song each week, to a brief given by your tutor at each class.  Course content focuses on these songs that you each create and also includes listening to and analysing a variety of known and lesser-known songs plus discussion about song writing theory and practice.

WHEN: 7.30pm-10pm every Thursday from Oct 3 − 14 Nov
WHERE: London - The Cockpit Theatre Gateforth St Marylebone NW8 8EH
